results.title: Mirror with a memory
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
The new art of photography saw the rise of many new inventors and practitioners. The earliest discoveries of Nicephore Niepce and Louis Daguerre are highlighted in this episode in the excellent series on the history of photography. Includes film shot in France of Niepce’s house and the window from which he took the earliest photograph. Narration: Brian Coe and Hugh Burden

results.title: Mirror of gesture
results.creator_credit: Edward Cornachio and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Explores the relationships between two major artistic forms of India - sculpture and dance. Emphasises the artistic correspondences between the two media, but also demonstrates how effectively the rhythms of the dancer have been transformed into sculptural form.

results.title: Mirror in the sky
results.creator_credit: Alex Strasser, Basil Wright and Realist Films
results.brief_description: A story of research and discovery which, through the work of such scientists as Hertz, Marconi, Heaviside and - more particularly - Sir Edward Appleton, has led to the development of modern radio-communications. Some of the techniques which owe their origin to Appleton’s concept of the ionosphere are now being applied to radar, to reliable world-wide radio links, and more recently, to the science of radio-astronomy.

results.title: Mirage
results.creator_credit: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: An intriguing inside-out view of moving figures and images, made by using a colour negative print, but with more vivid colors and with accompanying sound effects that suggest the same kind of inversion of the sound track. Figures and faces appear in a shimmering haze; the one most frequently seen is a figure skater flashing, pirouetting, fading. These are shades of people and of movements, appearing, retreating, as in a mirage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Raxlen, Tom Daly and ONF | NFB

results.title: Miracle of the mountains
results.creator_credit: Dick Marks, Bob Blasdal, John Schindler and Fortitude Productions
results.brief_description: Working on no more than a bushman’s intuition Bernard O’Reilly battled for days over miles of dense and seemingly impenetrable rainforest to try and locate a downed Stinson airliner. After a two day battle with the elements he not only located the crashed Stinson but assisted in carrying out two of the survivors. Narrated by John Schindler.

results.title: Miracle of life
results.creator_credit: Jun-Ichiro Takeda, David Adams, Rokuro Hayashi, Cinescience and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Details the biological precision of the reproductive process. Shows fertilisation, cell division and growth, and the development of the foetus to the first heartbeat.

results.title: Miracle in Java
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, United Nations. Dept. of Public Information and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Describes the work of Dr Raden Soeharso with his people in Indonesia as he endeavoured to help restore health and ability to work to the handicapped who were maimed and crippled as a result of war. Shows the rehabilitaiton centre built by Dr Soeharso and explains that with aid from the United Nations and other sources he and his staff are bringing new life to thousands.

results.title: Miracle at sea : the Tony Bullimore rescue
results.creator_credit: Guy Norris, Richard Dennison, John Gau Productions and Orana Films
results.brief_description: The Southern Ocean is the harshest place on earth. It is the Everest of the oceans and, for centuries, it has been the mariner’s ultimate challenge. This documentary reveals Tony Bullimore’s struggle to cling to life in the darkness of the freezing hull of his capsized 60ft yacht, Exide Challenger. He was two months into the Vendee Globe Around the World Yacht Race, 1300 miles south of Australia when disaster struck and his yacht overturned in 60ft waves. So began the biggest air sea rescue in the history of the Royal Australian Air Force. It would involve four aircraft, six air crew and one hundred and ninety hours of flying.

results.title: Minute movie masterpieces: 30 film classics in 30 minutes
results.creator_credit: Cliff Notes, Richard Foos and Rhino Video
results.brief_description: This compilation video gives a quick synopsis of 30 classic movies ranging from “Birth of a nation” to “A Star is born”. It uses key clips and highlights from each film and a whirlwind narration from speed readers to deliver maximum plot content in the one minute available, before moving on to the next title. Written and edited by David Starns.

results.title: Minus 107
results.creator_credit: Garry Wapshott, Peter Leslie Lamb, Artransa Park Studios and Consolidated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A history of the old gold-mining town of Walhalla in Gippsland, Victoria. Today it is almost a ghost town. Economics forced the closing of the mines after World War I and successive fires have destroyed what was left of the wooden buildings. Features archival footage and stills of the Long Tunnel Mine, richest in Victoria, and the railway to Moe opened in 1910.
